definitions: To engrave a design on a surface, especially on metal or glass, by means of acid or other corrosive agent.
To produce a design or figure on a material by eating into its surface with a corrosive agent.
To make a lasting impression; to fix permanently in the mind.
examples: The artist will etch the intricate design onto the copper plate.
The acid began to etch the pattern into the silicon.
The memory of that day will forever etch itself into my mind.
